Reviews.Title: “Quite good for the price”
Reviews.Author: suitcaseattheready
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Wednesday in March for one night. We booked a king size room online for 70$ and found the room very nice for the price. It was very spacious and clean. There was a nice real brick wall behind the bed. The washroom was quite small, but clean and it would be fine for a couple nights. The useable space in the closet was very small also, but if you don't need to hang much up it's fine. There is free coffee or hot water in the lobby at all times because there is no coffee maker in the room. There was no fridge in our room either. There is a continental breakfast downstairs in the morning. It was on until 9:30 am during the week. We got there at 8:45 and it was slim pickings, so you would need to make a move early for best selection. I did manage to snag the last yogourt and last banana, so it wasn't bad. There were still plenty of bagels and coffee. The parking was very convenient in the backyard of the hotel. It was 15$, plus taxes made 17$, so fairly standard for downtown. That's daily. There weren't a ton of spots, so perhaps in high season you have to park in a nearby lot instead. There is a whole foods market right next door, so you can get nice snacks and drinks there. We found a very nice all you can eat sushi restaurant about a 12 minute walk away on Yonge street near Davenport. Aji Sushi I think it was called. Very reasonable, fresh and tasty. The Japanese reception man at the hotel recommended it and he was right. The location was very good, and is very close to the ROM museum. We would stay there again for sure, if the price was similar.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience. Very accommodating &caring staff.”
Reviews.Author: Challengerb5
Reviews.Content: Asian guy genuinely cared to help us with a few small things b4 we could settle in. Great cont. Breakfast. A worthy hotel experience at twice the price!, well done!, A

Reviews.Title: “Best for value in the Yorkville area.”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: I've been staying here for years. The rooms are clean and functional. The staff are friendly and helpful. And you can't beat the price, given the location. High-end hotels a block or two away charge two to three times as much. Go there if you want to revel in hotel-room luxury. But go to the HoJo if you want a decent place to sleep, for an affordable price, and you plan to spend your time out in Yorkville, not in the room all day!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: louise240
Reviews.Content: Every member of the front desk staff and the manager of this hotel worked at the highest "friendly-professional" level to help us in every way they could.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal but a little dirty”
Reviews.Author: evanescencetabby
Reviews.Content: If I could I would give this 2.5 stars We got a really cheap deal new years weekend so im not complaining for the price we got but if I had paid more then would have been upset. Lobby seems nice, clean. The room was big but very outdated and worn. Bedroom seemed clean but there were stains on the floor and the bathroom was a little dirty. The bathroom is literally the size of a closet. The matress was very hard to me but clean sheets. Location is awesome, makes up for the room. Close to the subway and right in Yorkville. Very quiet and parking is right at the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Rose B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights here. The room was extremely attractive and larger than expected. The mattress was the best I've experienced in years. Due to the position of the room door, it was a tight squeeze bringing in the luggage. Plenty of towels in the bathroom. No coffee maker in the room, but coffee and hot tea was available in the lobby at all times. Also, a continental breakfast was provided. Despite the hotel's location, there was no appreciable noise within the room. Great shopping and subway was close by. Front desk personnel were pleasant and helpful. There is limited parking in the back for reasonable daily rate. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay within the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about the room”
Reviews.Author: Dannyc073
Reviews.Content: I knew it wasn't going to be the best of hotels when the door didn't automatically open on the way in! ;-) It looked up with the chap on reception though as he was friendly and really helpful when it came to advice on where to eat/drink. When I got to the room however I was shocked at the dated and well worn decor, dirty scratch marks on the wall greeted me upon entrance as did the faint smell of cigarette smoke. To be fair the room was pretty clean and comfortable although for some reason the cable for my television was ripped from it and sat on my table top...didn't make for the best reception so now I sit writing a review on trip advisor instead. I won't say don't stay here just that you won't be seeing me here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location for the price!”
Reviews.Author: ronnyVancouver
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Yorkville Hojo and must admit, for $100 a night, it is a great price for the best location in this city. Bloor St and Avenue Road remind me of Madison and 5th in NYC. So many great high end stores. We had a shopping weekend and with all of the money we saved on our hotel we spent on clothing at the high end shops! The hotel is definitely old but very clean with such kind staff. I was told that the hotel is under new management and that the rooms have all been deep cleaned and brought up to date. I enjoyed the breakfast that was included and of course the coffee. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Yorkville is my favorite part of Toronto and the Hojo is about $300 cheaper than other hotels in the area per night

Reviews.Title: “Good Bargain for the Area”
Reviews.Author: strasbourg155004
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Yorkville Howard Johnson during our visit to the Toronto Film Festival in September, 2011. The hotel was very conveniently located one block north of the Four Seasons Hotel so the location itself couldn't be better. The hotel is dated but they did provide a small continental breakfast consisting of muffins, croissants, tea, coffee and juice for only $144 per night. If you want to stay in Yorkville without the hugely inflated hotel prices, the Howard Johnson is your best bet. We will definitely return for next year's TIFF. Jo van Doorn, Ottawa, Ontario

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: silversister925
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Howard Johnsons Yorkville hotel for 3 days on business. The room we stayed in needed some updating but it was clean. The staff was very friendly, especially the afternoon front desk person. The location of the hotel is fabulous and makes up for any deficiencies in the rooms! I would definitely recommend this hotel! Again, it needs some updating but it well worth the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “old and tired”
Reviews.Author: eugdot
Reviews.Content: we usually stay downtown but we wanted to stay on the bloor st. subway line so we got an excellent price per night.....but this was not up to the normal standards of a howard johnson hotel..a complete reno is reqired for this hotel..they try to keep it clean but the carpets are horrible and filthy..the area around this hotel is awesome and seeing yorkville is a must...the bed was comfortable but the noise from other guests kept waking us up so the walls must be very thin...if they upgrade this hotel I would return and try it again...hopefully they will invest in coffeemakers for each room....

HotelInfo.Name: Howard Johnson Hotel Downtown Toronto - Yorkville
HotelInfo.Address: 89 Avenue Road, Toronto, Ontario M5R 2G3, Canada
